LanguageData.YorkshireTerrier.label: yorkshire terrier
LanguageData.YorkshireTerrier.description: A small, even-tempered dog. Originally bred to hunt rats, it later became a show and companionship animal. Some consider it useless, but the mood boost it gives by nuzzling can outweight the cost of feeding it.
LanguageData.YorkshireTerrier.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.YorkshireTerrier_Leather.label: yorkshire terrier leather
LanguageData.YorkshireTerrier_Corpse.label: yorkshire terrier corpse
LanguageData.Husky.label: husky
LanguageData.Husky.description: A large, energetic dog with a thick fur coat for remaining comfortable in arctic environments.
LanguageData.Husky.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Husky.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Husky.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Husky_Leather.label: husky leather
LanguageData.Husky_Corpse.label: husky corpse
LanguageData.LabradorRetriever.label: labrador retriever
LanguageData.LabradorRetriever.description: A very versatile, medium-sized dog. Originally bred to retrieve birds shot on the hunt, the lab is also an excellent guard dog, play pal, and family friend.
LanguageData.LabradorRetriever.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.LabradorRetriever.tools.1.label: right claw

LanguageData.LabradorRetriever_Leather.label: labrador retriever leather
LanguageData.LabradorRetriever_Corpse.label: labrador retriever corpse
LanguageData.GermanShepherd.label: shepherd
LanguageData.GermanShepherd.description: A large working dog that is usually tan and black in color. It is one of the most intelligent breeds of dog and they are prized for their trainability.
